summary: This bill, the "Safeguard American Voter Eligibility Act" (SAVE Act), amends the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 to mandate proof of U.S. citizenship for voter registration in federal elections. It defines acceptable forms of proof, updates registration processes, mandates state action to remove non-citizen voters, and alters mail-in registration procedures. The bill also specifies Election Assistance Commission guidance and addresses provisional ballots and state exemptions.
